ARABIC: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ فَإِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمْرًا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is He who gives life and causes to die. When He decides on something, He just says to it, 'Be!' and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: It is He who gives you life and death. When He creates a thing, He has only to say: "Be," and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He it is Who gives life and causes death. Whenever He decrees a thing, He only commands to it “Be”, and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: It is He Who gives life and causes things to die. When He decides to do something, He only says, "Exist," and it comes into existence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: It is He Who gives life and death; so whenever He wills a thing, He only says to it “Be” – it thereupon happens!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: It is He Who gives life and causes death. And when He decides upon a thing He says to it only: "Be!" - and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He it is Who gives life and brings death, so when He decrees an affair, He only says to it: Be, and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: It is He who gives life, and makes to die; and when He decrees a thing, He but says to it 'Be,' and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He it is Who quickeneth and giveth death. When He ordaineth a thing, He saith unto it only: Be! and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: It is He who gives life and death, and when He ordains a thing, He says only, "Be!" and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He it is Who causeth life and death. Then whensoever He decreeth an affair He only saith Unto it: be, and it becometh.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: It is He who gives life and brings death. When He decides on a matter, He just says to it, ‘Be!’ and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: It is He Who gives Life and Death; and when He decides upon an affair, He says to it, "Be", and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He it is Who gives life and causes death. And when He decides upon a thing He says to it only: "Be!" and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: It is He who gives life and makes to die, and when He decrees a thing, He says to it: 'Be' and it is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: It is He who gives life and death; and when He decides on a thing, He just says to it, “Be,” and it comes to be.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He it is who gives life and causes death; and when He decrees a matter, He but says to it, "Be," and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [40:68] He it is Who gives life and brings death. So when He decides upon a matter, [when] He wants to bring something into existence, He only says to it ‘Be!’ and it is (read fa-yakūnu, or fa-yakūna [in the subjunctive] on account of an implied [preceding] an). In other words, it comes into existence after He has willed it, that which is signified by the said words.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He it is Who quickeneth) for the resurrection (and giveth death) in the life of the world. (When He ordaineth a thing) when He wants to create a child without a father, such is the case with Jesus, (He saith unto it only: Be! and it is) a son without a father! And it is also said that this means: when He wants the Day of Judgement to happen, He simply says: Be! And it is.
